position.marginalia_text: Ex ijs ergo apparet, quod si bene sciamus facere Putrefactione[m], qua[e] est turbatio Elementoru[m], seu Deligatio, vel Mundificatio, et bene per sublimatione[m] separare hoc ab hoc, [id est] puru[m] ab impuro, nobis bene erit; et si non, male. [etc]

marginalia.translation: From these it is therefore apparent that if we know well how to generate putrefaction from the perturbation of the elements and through sublimation nad trituration, to separate this from that through sublimation, that is, pure from impure, then all will be well for us, but if not, it will be bad.

position.marginalia_text: Et cum fumus ille fuerit mundus et albus, tunc erit aptus ad coniungendum cum suo corpore, vt dixim[us] supra, aliter non, vt scitis. Vnde inquit Morienus. Si quis Anima[m] extraxerit et ea[m] sursum ascendere fecerit, et ab ea o[mn]em nigredinem et fa[e]torem abluerit, postea cum suo corpore coniunxerit, et denum mortificaverit, videbit maxima mirabilia in mundo.

marginalia.translation: And since this smoke is clean and white, it will be suitable for conjoining with its body, as we said above, just as we know. As Morienus says, if anyone has extracted the soul and has made it rise up high, and has previously washed away from it all the blackness and foulness, then when he will conjoin it with its body, and he will look at the greatest miracle in the world.

position.marginalia_text: Visa igitur generatione illius Fumi albi, qui fit pet separatione[m]

marginalia.translation: Therefore, as the production of this white smoke is seen, which is made through separation
